ext_descriptions.ext_description: The Expression module represents expression itself. It can represent a numeric, boolean and a string expression.
An Expression entity is a Generic_expression restricted to numeric, boolean,string or any other suitable domain of values.
A Numeric_variable is a variable that stands for a number value.
A Numeric_variable can only be a real variable or an integer variable.
An Int_numeric_variable is a variable that stands for an integer value.
A Real_numeric_variable is a variable that stands for a real value.
A Boolean_variable is a variable that stands for a Boolean value.
A String_variable is a variable that stands for a STRING value.
A Numeric_expression is an expression of which the range is the NUMBER data type defined in 8.1.1 of ISO 10303-11.
a Boolean attribute that indicates if an expression evaluates to integer or not.
a Boolean attribute that indicates if an expression is mappable to the SQL query language.
A Simple_numeric_expression is either a numeric literal or a numeric variable
A Literal_number is an EXPRESS NUMBER literal . A Literal_number may be either an integer literal or a real literal.The EXPRESS NUMBER data type has the numeric values as domain
a NUMBER literal value.
An Int_literal is an EXPRESS INTEGER literal.An EXPRESS INTEGER literal represents an integer VALUE that is composed of one or more digits.
an INTEGER literal value.
A Real_literal is an EXPRESS REAL literal.An EXPRESS REAL literal represents a real VALUE that is composed of a mantissa and an optional exponent; the mantissa shall include a decimal point.
a REAL literal value.
A Multiple_arity_numeric_expression is a multiple arity operator whose range is the NUMBER data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A list containing the parameters of the multiple arity operator. The length of this list is equal to the arity of the operator.

The Plus_expression entity carries the semantics of the '+' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.The plus_expression is an expression which evaluates to the sum of all its operands. In the ISO13584_expression_schema, all these operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain.

The Mult_expression entity carries the semantics of the '-' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.The minus_expression is an expression which evaluates to the difference of its operands. In the ISO13584_expression_schema, all these operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain.
A Multiple_arity_function_call is a multiple-arity operator on NUMBER data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Binary_boolean_expression is a binary operator of which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A list containing the two parameters of the binary operator.

The Minus_expression entity carries the semantics of the '-' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.The minus_expression is an expression which evaluates to the difference of its operands. In the ISO13584_expression_schema, all these operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain.

The Div_expression entity carries the semantics of the EXPRESS 'DIV' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.The div_expression is an expression which evaluates to the integer division of its operands. In the ISO13584_expression_schema, all these operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain. The result is an integer number. If either operand is of data type REAL, it is truncated to an INTEGER before the operation, i.e. any fractional part is lost.

The Mod_expression entity carries the semantics of the EXPRESS 'MOD' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.The mod_expression is an expression which evaluates to the first argument value modulo operation of the second argument value. Its operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain. The result is an integer number. If either operand is of data type REAL, it is truncated to an INTEGER before the operation, i.e. any fractional part is lost.

The Slash_expression entity carries the semantics of the EXPRESS '/' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.entity carries the semantics of the EXPRESS '/' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data type.

The Power_expression entity carries the semantics of the EXPRESS '**' operator, defined in ISO 10303-11, on NUMBER data typeThe power_expression is an expression which evaluates to the exponentiation of the first operand value to the second operand value. Its operands shall evaluate to a number in the number data type domain. The result is a number.
A Binary_function_call is a binary operator on NUMBER data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
An Unary_numeric_expression is an unary operator whose range is the NUMBER data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A numeric expression that represents the parameter of the unary operator.
A String_expression is an Expression whose range is the EXPRESS STRING data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Simple_string_expression is an unary operator of whose range is EXPRESS STRING data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A String_literal is an EXPRESS STRING literal.The EXPRESS STRING data type has as its domain sequences of characters.
The_value is a STRING literal value.

The Index_expression carries the semantics of the string indexing operator ('[]') defined in ISO 10303-11.The Index_expression string operator takes two operands, the string value (represented by the operand attribute) being indexed by the index specification (represented by the index attribute). The resulting string value is the character at position the value of the index operator.
the String_expression that represents the STRING.
the integer Numeric_expression that indicates the index value.
The first operand shall be a String_expression and the second operand shall be a Numeric_expression.
The position described by the index operand shall be an integer value.

The Substring_expression carries the semantics of the EXPRESS substring indexing operator ('[:]') defined in ISO 10303-11.The Substring_expression string operator takes three operands, the string value (represented by the operand attribute) being indexed by the index specification (represented by the index1 and index2 attributes). The substring_expression evaluates to a string value of length (index2 - index1 + 1). The resulting string value is equivalent to the sequence of characters at position index1 through index2.
the String_expression from which a substring is extracted.
the Numeric_expression that indicates the low bound of the substring in operand.
the Numeric_expression that indicates the high bound of the substring in operand.
Operand shall be a String_expression, index1 and index2 shall be Numeric_expression.
The Substring_expression operands LIST shall contain three elements.
index1 shall evaluate to an INTEGER value.
index2 shall evaluate to an INTEGER value.

The Concat_expression carries the semantics of the concatenation ('+') operator defined in ISO 10303-11, on the STRING data type defined in ISO 10303-11. The Concat_expression operator accepts at least two string_expressions as operands and evaluates to a string value resulting from the concatenation of all the elements of the SELF\Multiple_arity_generic_expression.operands list. These elements are concatenated in the list order.
the String_expressions to be concatenated.
The Format_function carries the semantics of the FORMAT function defined in ISO 10303-11.
the Numeric_expression that is to be formatted.
formatting commands that defines the appearance of the result.
The Value_to_format shall be a Numeric_expression and the Format_string shall be a String_expression.
A Boolean_expression is an Expression for which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Simple_boolean_expression is an unary operator for which the range is BOOLEAN, such a data type being defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Boolean_literal is an EXPRESS BOOLEAN literal.The EXPRESS Boolean data type has as its domain the set containing the two literals TRUE and FALSE.
a BOOLEAN literal value The EXPRESS Boolean data type has as its domain the set containing the two literals TRUE and FALSE.
An Unary_boolean_expression is an unary operator for which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
The Not_expression entity carries the semantics of the 'NOT' on Boolean data type operator defined in ISO 10303-11.The NOT operator requires one Boolean operand and evaluates to a Boolean value.
The Boolean_expression that represents the operand of the 'NOT' operator.
A Binary_boolean_expression is a binary operator of which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Multiple_arity_boolean_expression is a multiple-arity operator for which the range is the same as the EXPRESS BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
The occurrences of Boolean_expression that represents the parameters of the m-arity operator.

The Xor_expression carries the semantics of the 'XOR' operator defined in ISO 10303-11.The XOR operator requires two Boolean operands and evaluates to a Boolean value that is the exclusive disjunction of the two operands.
The two Boolean_expression operands of the XOR operator that shall be boolean_expressions.

The Equals_expression entity carries the semantics of the ':=:' instance equal operator defined in ISO 10303-11, the domain of which is entities of data type Generic_expression The entity instance equality operator accepts two compatible instance values that are generic_expression and evaluates to a Boolean value. In the context of the ISO13584_expression_schema the two generic_expressions instance values are compatible either if their data types are the same, or if one data type is a subtype of the other one.

The And_expression entity carries the semantics of the 'AND' operator defined in ISO 10303-11 and uses its associativity property to handle multiple arity.The AND operator requires at least two Boolean expressions and evaluates to a Boolean value that is the conjunction of the two operands.

The Or_expression entity carries the semantics of the 'OR' operator defined in ISO 10303-11 and uses its associativity property to handle multiple arity. The OR operator requires at least two Boolean expressions and evaluates to a Boolean value that is the inclusive disjunction of the two operands.

The Comparison_expression expressions carry the semantics of the different value comparison operators defined in ISO 10303-11 restricted to the NUMBER, BOOLEAN and STRING EXPRESS data types. Both operands shall have the same data type.
A list of generic_expressions that contains the expressions to be compared.
The operands of the Comparison_expression shall be of compatible in type.

A Comparison_equal carries the semantics of the value equal ('=') operator defined in ISO 10303-11 restricted to the NUMBER, BOOLEAN and STRING EXPRESS data types. Both operands shall have the same data type.The comparison_equal evaluates to TRUE if the two operands evaluate to the same value.

A Like_expression carries the semantics of the LIKE string matching operator defined in ISO 10303-11. The first operand is the target string. The second operand is the pattern string. The special characters (often called "wild cards") in the pattern string are defined in ISO 10303-11
The operand list shall contain twogeneric_expressions instances that are string_expressions.
the bound_1 operand of the interval expression (see 12.2.4 of ISO 10303-11).
the interval_item operand of the interval expression (see 12.2.4 of ISO 10303-11).
the bound_2 operand of the interval expression (see 12.2.4 of ISO 10303-11).
The data type of the operands shall be expressions.
The types of the expressions to be compared in the interval_expressions shall evaluates to comparable expressions.
A Sql_mappable_defined_function is a function intended to be subtyped in the information models that use the ISO13584_expressions_schema to specify that some Generic_expression is mappable onto SQL.
A Defined_function is a (strongly typed) function intended to be subtyped in the information models that use the ISO13584_expressions_schema.
A String_defined_function is any application-defined operator of which the range is the STRING data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
A Boolean_defined_function is any application-defined operator of which the range is the BOOLEAN data type defined in ISO 10303-11.
The Is_int_expr function checks if a syntactically correct expression evaluates to an integer value or not.
It is a Generic_expression.
The is_SQL_mappable function checks if the acyclic graph that represents an expression only contains elements that are mappable to SQL (Structured Query Language).
It is an Expression.
